Wisdom: عَجِبْتُ لِرَجُلٍ يَأْتِيهِ أَخُوهُ الْمُسْلِمُ فِي حَاجَةٍ فَيَمْتَنِعُ عَنْ قَضَائِهَا وَلَا يَرَى نَفْسَهُ لِلْخَيْرِ أَهْلًا فَهَبْ أَنَّهُ لَا ثَوَابَ يُرْجَى وَلَا عِقَابَ يُتَّقَى أَ فَتَزْهَدُونَ فِي مَكَارِمِ الْأَخْلَاقِ
enWisdom: I am amazed at the person who is approached by his Muslim brother in need and refuses to fulfil it, not deeming himself worthy of [doing] good; so assume that he does not desire any reward nor does he fear any punishmentDo they lack interest in [acquiring] noble traits?
The benefit of thinking is finding solutions
The best of people are those who benefit others the most

Wisdom: إِنَّ حَوَائِجَ النَّاسِ إِلَيْكُمْ نِعْمَةٌ مِنَ اللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ فَاغْتَنِمُوهَا وَلَا تَمَلُّوهَا فَتَتَحَوَّلَ نِقَماً
enWisdom: Verily the needs of the people that are addressed to you are a blessing from Allah upon you, so take advantage of them and do not be weary of them, lest they should turn into [divine] wrath

Wisdom: إِنَّمَا الْمَجْدُ أَنْ تُعْطِيَ فِي الْغُرْمِ [الْعَزْمِ‏] وَتَعْفُوَ عَنِ الْجُرْمِ
enWisdom: erily distinction is nothing but your giving that which you owe [of the rights of others] and forgiving the offences [of others]

Wisdom: تَبَادَرُوا الْمَكَارِمَ وَسَارِعُوا إِلَى تَحَمُّلِ الْمَغَارِمِ وَاسْعَوْا فِي حَاجَةِ مَنْ هُوَ نَائِمٌ يَحْسُنُ لَكُمْ فِي الدَّارَيْنِ الْجَزَاءُ وَتَنَالُوا مِنَ اللَّهِ عَظِيمَ الْحَبَاءِ
enWisdom: Rush towards noble deeds, make haste in bearing the liabilities [of others] and hurry to fulfil the needs of the one who is unaware [of your assistance], your reward will thus be good in both abodes, and you will acquire a great prize from Allah
When one has hope in you, [then] do not disappoint his hope

Wisdom: مَنْ حَرَمَ السَّائِلَ مَعَ الْقُدْرَةِ عُوقِبَ بِالْحِرْمَانِ
enWisdom: One who conceals the favour [that has been done to him] is punished with deprivation

Wisdom: مَنِ احْتَاجَ إِلَيْكَ وَجَبَ إِسْعَافُهُ عَلَيْكَ
enWisdom: When someone turns to you with his needs, it becomes obligatory upon you to help him

Wisdom: مِنَ الْمُرُوَّةِ أَنَّكَ إِذَا سُئِلْتَ أَنْ تَتَكَلَّفَ وَإِذَا سَأَلْتَ أَنْ تُخَفِّفَ
enWisdom: It is from magnanimity for you to go out of your way when you are asked [for something] and to lighten [your requests] when you ask [someone for anything]

Wisdom: مَا مِنْ عَمَلٍ أَحَبَّ إِلَى اللَّهِ تَعَالَى مِنْ ضُرٍّ يَكْشِفُهُ رَجُلٌ عَنْ رَجُلٍ
enWisdom: No action is more beloved to Allah, the Most High, than for a person to remove the distress [and adversity] from another person

Wisdom: مُصِيبَةٌ فِي غَيْرِكَ لَكَ أَجْرُهَا خَيْرٌ مِنْ مُصِيبَةٍ بِكَ لِغَيْرِكَ ثَوَابُهَا وَأَجْرُهَا
enWisdom: A hardship that befalls others and has reward for you is better than the hardship that befalls you while its reward and recompense is for others

Wisdom: لَا تُؤَخِّرْ إِنَالَةَ الْمُحْتَاجِ إِلَى غَدٍ فَإِنَّكَ لَا تَدْرِي مَا يَعْرِضُ لَكَ وَلَهُ فِي غَدٍ
enWisdom: Do not delay giving the needy to tomorrow, for you do not know what will happen to you or to him tomorrow
Do not frustrate the needy even if he insists [for more]

Wisdom: أَقِمِ الرَّغْبَةَ إِلَيْكَ مَقَامَ الْحِرْمَةِ بِكَ
enWisdom: Make others incline towards you instead of distancing themselves from you
Hastening the loss of hope [in others] is one of the two triumphs
